comments.content:
Nice.   
I really like how all of it is always wiped away in the end. I wish people hadn't been taking photos. And in a way I wish it hadn't been recorded either.   
   
hhp

The technique is wonderful, but I was struck by how incredibly banal almost all the images were: the sort of thing one would ignore completely in another medium. Often, in the early stages of each, there would be a moment when the abstract arrangement was quite powerful and interesting, but then he would turn it into a rather sickly figurative image. Pity.
